DataElement.preferredName: QuickDASH Outcome Measure 8 Past Week Extent that Arm, Shoulder, or Hand Problem Limited Work or Other Regular Activities Score 5 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A person's stated observation during the past week whether they limited their work or other regular daily activities as a result of their arm, shoulder or hand problem, using a 5 point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: QuickDASH Outcome Measure Past Week Extent that Arm, Shoulder, or Hand Problem Limited Work or Other Regular Activities Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An 11-item questionnaire designed to measure physical function and symptoms in people with any or multiple musculoskeletal disorders of the upper limb._The most recent week. May include the present day._A question about the extent that an individual's arm, shoulder, or hand problems limited their work or other regular, daily activities._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An 11-item questionnaire designed to measure physical function and symptoms in people with any or multiple musculoskeletal disorders of the upper limb.

Concepts.definition: An 11-item questionnaire designed to measure physical function and symptoms in people with any or multiple musculoskeletal disorders of the upper limb.

Concepts.longName: Extent that Arm, Shoulder, or Hand Problem Limited Work or Other Regular Activities
Concepts.definition: A question about the extent that an individual's arm, shoulder, or hand problems limited their work or other regular, daily activities.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes with range from 1 (Not at all interfere) to 5 (Extremely)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual is or was moderately limited by something.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual is or was moderately limited by something.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual is unable to do something.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual is unable to do something.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual feels limited a lot.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual feels limited a lot.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual feels limited a little.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual feels limited a little.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual does not feel limited at all.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual does not feel limited at all.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

Concepts.definition: An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.

ClassificationSchemes.longName: QuickDash (Disabilities of the Arm and Shoulder and Hand) Outcome Measure

ReferenceDocuments.name: During the past week, were yo
ReferenceDocuments.description: During the past week, were you limited in your work or other regular daily activities as a result of your arm, shoulder or hand problem?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Using PRO/HRQoL Measures
ReferenceDocuments.description: This data element is part of a full set of items that comprise a PRO/HRQoL measure. The full set must be used without any changes to the questions or value set in order to retain the validity and reliability associated with the measure. Changes may not be made to these documents. In cases where retaining the question set intact to preserve the validity and reliability are not as important as advancing the science, questions may be used individually or in combination with other measure questions.
